title: Issue with Docker image based on scratch
body:
The scratch-based Docker image is not working.

```standard_init_linux.go:228: exec user process caused: no such file or directory```

* To run with scratch, it seems we need to disable CGO with `CGO_ENABLED=0`
* But with CGO disabled, part of the bls stack doesn't build

To reproduce the build issue: 

```
$ CGO_ENABLED=0 GOOS=linux go build -v -o mev-boost ./cmd/mev-boost

github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary/bls
# github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary/bls
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:9:28: undefined: SecretKey
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:9:40: undefined: Fr
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:13:26: undefined: Fr
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:13:31: undefined: SecretKey
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:19:28: undefined: PublicKey
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:19:40: undefined: G1
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:23:26: undefined: G1
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:23:31: undefined: PublicKey
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:29:23: undefined: Sign
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:29:30: undefined: G2
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/herumi/bls-eth-go-binary@v0.0.0-20210917013441-d37c07cfda4e/bls/cast.go:29:30: too many errors
github.com/supranational/blst/bindings/go
# github.com/supranational/blst/bindings/go
../../../go/pkg/mod/github.com/supranational/blst@v0.3.5/bindings/go/rb_tree.go:130:18: undefined: Message
```

Might just be some missing libraries ü§î 

Ideally we'd like to use scratch as base-image, or another way with a very small image size. To make scratch work, we'd need to make that build command work.

I've found a way to fix the issue but it has some drawbacks :
1. We have to use `alpine`
2. The image size grows up to `18 MB`

Below are the steps which helped me understand the error along with their according fixes :

## 1. Errors from your build

Because you are using [prysm bls implementation](https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/29d48dfe7eb38959752048aec700f31c3abf7484/shared/bls/blst/public_key.go#L1),
it also comes with some limitations, i.e. `CGO` needs to be enabled.

## 2. Building the current docker image
I've spawn up an Ubuntu 20.04 instance on scaleway, installed docker + go and built the docker image using :
```shell
docker build -t mev-boost:latest .
```

Everything works perfectly, until I start the container :
```shell
root@scw-elastic-maxwell:~/Documents/mev-boost# docker run mev-boost:latest
exec /app/mev-boost: no such file or directory
```

## 3. Switching to alpine

As I wanted to debug the error, I switched to `alpine` so that I can use `sh` :
```dockerfile
# ...
FROM alpine
WORKDIR /app
# ...
```

I jumped in the container using `docker run --rm -it --entrypoint sh mev-boost:latest`, ran the `ldd mev-boost` 
command and got :
```shell
root@scw-elastic-maxwell:~/Documents/mev-boost# docker run --rm -it --entrypoint sh mev-boost:latest
/app # ldd mev-boost 
        /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x7fb8d239f000)
        libpthread.so.0 => /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x7fb8d239f000)
Error loading shared library libstdc++.so.6: No such file or directory (needed by mev-boost)
        libc.so.6 => /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x7fb8d239f000)
Error relocating mev-boost: __cxa_guard_release: symbol not found
Error relocating mev-boost: __cxa_guard_acquire: symbol not found
```

Some libraries are definitely missing.

## 4. Fix missing shared objects

The quick fix is to install the following packages :
- `libgcc`
- `libstdc++`

This can be achieved by adding the following to the Dockerfile :
```dockerfile
# ...
FROM alpine
WORKDIR /app

RUN apk add --no-cache libgcc libstdc++
# ...
```

Then I rebuilt, try to run the container and still got :
```shell
root@scw-elastic-maxwell:~/Documents/mev-boost# docker run mev-boost:latest
exec /app/mev-boost: no such file or directory
```

After adding the `binutils` package temporally to the dockerfile, I was able to use `readelf` to get the required 
program interpreter :
```shell
/app # readelf -l mev-boost | grep "program interpreter"
      [Requesting program interpreter: /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2]
```

Which can be fixed by adding one last package :
- `libc6-compat`

## 5. Final docker image
```dockerfile
# syntax=docker/dockerfile:1
FROM golang:1.18 as builder
WORKDIR /build
ADD . /build/
RUN --mount=type=cache,target=/root/.cache/go-build make build-for-docker

FROM alpine
WORKDIR /app

RUN apk add --no-cache libgcc libstdc++ libc6-compat

COPY --from=builder /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt /etc/ssl/certs/
COPY --from=builder /build/mev-boost /app/mev-boost
EXPOSE 18550
ENTRYPOINT ["/app/mev-boost"]
```

Final size: `18.3 MB`.
Thanks so much, this is awesome üëç
I've updated the existing PR, with a suggestion so that you only have to click 1 button ;)
